The Partnership

South Ribble and Chorley have shared senior leadership since 2008. But despite the shared management, their spending profiles tell different stories:

MetricSouth RibbleChorley
Total Spend£146M£331M
Transactions16,06517,212
Avg Transaction£9,085£19,223
Top Supplier %12.6% (LCC)43.9% (LCC)
HHI495 (Low)2,131 (Moderate)
Council Tax£236.78£215.99

Key Differences

Chorley's spending is significantly more concentrated — its HHI of 2,131 is more than four times South Ribble's 495. This is largely driven by Chorley's much larger payments to Lancashire County Council (43.9% vs 12.6%).

South Ribble's average transaction size of £9,085 is less than half of Chorley's £19,223, suggesting more granular purchasing or different service delivery models.
